title: Google\Cloud\Spanner\V1\ReadRequest
name: ReadRequest
description:
The request for [Read][google.spanner.v1.Spanner.Read] and [StreamingRead][google.spanner.v1.Spanner.StreamingRead].

Generated from protobuf message google.spanner.v1.ReadRequest

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.session
params.description: Required. The session in which the read should be performed.

params.name: data.transaction
params.description: The transaction to use. If none is provided, the default is a temporary read-only transaction with strong concurrency.

params.name: data.table
params.description: Required. The name of the table in the database to be read.

params.name: data.index
params.description: If non-empty, the name of an index on [table][google.spanner.v1.ReadRequest.table]. This index is used instead of the table primary key when interpreting [key_set][google.spanner.v1.ReadRequest.key_set] and sorting result rows. See [key_set][google.spanner.v1.ReadRequest.key_set] for further information.

params.name: data.columns
params.description: Required. The columns of [table][google.spanner.v1.ReadRequest.table] to be returned for each row matching this request.

params.name: data.key_set
params.description: Required. key_set identifies the rows to be yielded. key_set names the primary keys of the rows in [table][google.spanner.v1.ReadRequest.table] to be yielded, unless [index][google.spanner.v1.ReadRequest.index] is present. If [index][google.spanner.v1.ReadRequest.index] is present, then [key_set][google.spanner.v1.ReadRequest.key_set] instead names index keys in [index][google.spanner.v1.ReadRequest.index]. If the [partition_token][google.spanner.v1.ReadRequest.partition_token] field is empty, rows are yielded in table primary key order (if [index][google.spanner.v1.ReadRequest.index] is empty) or index key order (if [index][google.spanner.v1.ReadRequest.index] is non-empty). If the [partition_token][google.spanner.v1.ReadRequest.partition_token] field is not empty, rows will be yielded in an unspecified order. It is not an error for the key_set to name rows that do not exist in the database. Read yields nothing for nonexistent rows.

params.name: data.limit
params.description: If greater than zero, only the first limit rows are yielded. If limit is zero, the default is no limit. A limit cannot be specified if partition_token is set.

params.name: data.resume_token
params.description: If this request is resuming a previously interrupted read, resume_token should be copied from the last [PartialResultSet][google.spanner.v1.PartialResultSet] yielded before the interruption. Doing this enables the new read to resume where the last read left off. The rest of the request parameters must exactly match the request that yielded this token.

params.name: data.partition_token
params.description: If present, results will be restricted to the specified partition previously created using PartitionRead(). There must be an exact match for the values of fields common to this message and the PartitionReadRequest message used to create this partition_token.
